caption.text: Open Science in “Science Shop 2.0”: Aims, stakeholders and tools.

cell.text:
Promote accessibility in terms of participation to research and its comprehensibility
Research products should be freely available and everyone should have the equal right to access knowledge
Incorporate an alternative metric system for measuring research impact

Research community
Policy Makers
General Public
CBPR, Citizen Science, Science PR, Science Blogging, Open access, intellectual property rights, Open data, Open code

statement.text: Central aims is to Promote accessibility in terms of participation to research and its comprehensibility.
Tools and methods are General Public.

caption.text: Claims related to participatory research in initial questionnaire.

cell.text: CBPR is an important element of “Science Shop 2.0”
Community members should be involved at all levels (input, process and outcome levels) of research carried out at / facilitated by “Science Shop 2.0”
In “Science Shop 2.0”, CBPR elements are important in deciding what is to be researched
In “Science Shop 2.0”, CBPR elements are important in implementing the project
In “Science Shop 2.0”, CBPR elements are important in advising on and interpreting results
In “Science Shop 2.0”, CBPR elements are important in disseminating the results

statement.text: Community members should be involved at all levels for C1.4 Claims.
CBPR elements are important in disseminating the results in Claim1.8.
